data.TITLE: WordPress Advanced Ads Plugin: Remote Code Execution (RCE) Vulnerability (CVE-2025-13592)
data.DIAGNOSIS:
The WordPress Advanced Ads - Ad Manager & AdSense Plugin is the most comprehensive ad management tool available for WordPress.

The Advanced Ads is vulnerable to Remote Code Execution (RCE) via the 'change-ad__content' shortcode parameter.

Affected Versions:
WordPress Advanced Ads Plugin before, and including, 2.0.14

QID Detection Logic:
This QID sends a HTTP GET request and checks for vulnerable version of WordPress Advanced Ads Plugin running on the target application.
data.CONSEQUENCE: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an authenticated attacker, with Editor-Level permission or above, to execute code on the server.
data.SOLUTION:
Customers are advised to upgrade to WordPress Advanced Ads 2.0.15 or later version to remediate the vulnerability.

Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:

Advanced Ads

data.TITLE: AlmaLinux Security Update for libpng (ALSA-2026:0238)
data.DIAGNOSIS:
AlmaLinux has released a security update for libpng to fix the vulnerabilities.

QID Detection Logic (Authenticated):
QID utilizes the target system's package manager, such as "rpm", to enumerate packages and map them with vendor advisories to identify vulnerable versions.
data.CONSEQUENCE: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could lead to a security breach or affect confidentiality, integrity, and availability.
data.SOLUTION:
Refer to AlmaLinux security advisory ALSA-2026:0238 for updates and patch information.

Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:

ALSA-2026:0238:AlmaLinux
